Class DateTime

java.lang.Object
DateTime
public class DateTime extends Object
The DateTime class represents a specific point in time with year, month, day, hour, and minute components. It provides methods for displaying and retrieving date and time information in different formats.

This class is used throughout the expense tracking system to timestamp budgets and expenses, enabling temporal analysis of financial data.

Version:
0.2
Author:
Magdaluyo, Alaine Carlo R., Cruz, Zachary Andre A.

  • Constructor Details

    • DateTime

      public DateTime(String year, String month, String day, String hour, String minute)
      Constructs a new DateTime object with the specified components.
      Parameters:
      year - the year as a string (e.g., "2025")
      month - the month as a string (e.g., "11")
      day - the day as a string (e.g., "15")
      hour - the hour as a string in 24-hour format (e.g., "14")
      minute - the minute as a string (e.g., "30")

  • Method Details

    • displayDate

      public void displayDate()
      Displays the date in MM/DD/YYYY format to the console. For example: "11/15/2025"

    • displayTime

      public void displayTime()
      Displays the time in HH:MM format to the console. For example: "14:30"

    • getYear

      public String getYear()
      Returns the year component of the date.
      Returns:
      the year as a String

    • getMonth

      public String getMonth()
      Returns the month component of the date.
      Returns:
      the month as a String

    • getDay

      public String getDay()
      Returns the day component of the date.
      Returns:
      the day as a String

    • getHour

      public String getHour()
      Returns the hour component of the time.
      Returns:
      the hour as a String in 24-hour format

    • getMinute

      public String getMinute()
      Returns the minute component of the time.
      Returns:
      the minute as a String

    • getDateString

      public String getDateString()
      Returns the date in MM/DD/YYYY format as a String.
      Returns:
      the formatted date string (e.g., "11/15/2025")

    • getTimeString

      public String getTimeString()
      Returns the time in HH:MM format as a String.
      Returns:
      the formatted time string (e.g., "14:30")

    • getDateTimeString

      public String getDateTimeString()
      Returns the full datetime in MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM format as a String.
      Returns:
      the formatted datetime string (e.g., "11/15/2025 14:30")
